item.title: My GirlFriend Looks Like An Alien/Is Too Ugly That It Makes The Client Crash!
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

			p.playerLook[0] = 1;
			p.pHead=48;
			p.pTorso=56;
			p.pArms=61;
			p.pHands=68;
			p.pLegs=72;
			p.pFeet=79;
			p.pBeard=-1;
			p.updateRequired = true;

you need the playerLook[0] = 1 because that defines if it is a female or not… im not sure if that will fix your problem but when i used that code without the playerLook[0] it made the females all fucked up

Read full topic
item.source: My GirlFriend Looks Like An Alien/Is Too Ugly That It Makes The Client Crash!

item.title: My GirlFriend Looks Like An Alien/Is Too Ugly That It Makes The Client Crash!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Well My Girl-Friend.

Shes a girl, and a friend lol.(Account I just logged into).

I made an option for you to login, so when you login you chose your sex, either it be a Girl/Woman, Boy/Man.

The guy part is ok, so when you click it, it turns you into a guy.

But the girl…

The client just crashes or like the pic i posted above, it shows me that. It’s a girl with guy hair, and HUGE forehead.

I tried the number for pHead, 45 through 55 which are the girl ones that i am aware of. Does anyone know whats wrong? I haven’t looked at the other, but I don’t think that’s the problem.

Can anyone tell me what other numbers there are for girls?

Code in client class:

if(sex) { msg("You chose Girl/Woman"); pHead = 52; pTorso = 57; pArms = 61; pHands = 67; pLegs = 72; pFeet = 80; pBeard = -1; //Girls Don't Have Beards, Cept European Ones! updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; RemoveAllWindows(); sex = false; }

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: My GirlFriend Looks Like An Alien/Is Too Ugly That It Makes The Client Crash!
